channel.title: Help with environmental variables
channel.description:
Hey, I'm having a little problem with my variable's.
Im using a windows 7 64 bit operating system
my current settings that aint working..
PATH C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin;
CLASSPATH C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin;
Im wanting to just play around on a server for fun no one will play just me and my computer but the server wont load on 127.0.0.1 and it is saying this when I run the source's run "The system cannot find the path specified.".
This is what it's edit is set to.
"C:\Program Files(x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_3\bin\java.exe"
So what am I doing wrong please help as I want to be able to play around and I cant figure out what im doing wrong at all.
Thanks
[b][size=18pt]Someone please message me or something and help I know you guys are smarter then me about this. Please help[/size][/b]

item.title: Help with environmental variables
item.dc:creator: @HIGHK9 HIGHK9
item.description:
@HIGHK9 wrote:

Nevermind I found out it was cause I put _3 instead of _03 in the run folder. It works now. Thanks tho.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with environmental variables
item.dc:creator: @HIGHK9 HIGHK9
item.description:
@HIGHK9 wrote:

Hey, I’m having a little problem with my variable’s.

Im using a windows 7 64 bit operating system

my current settings that aint working…

PATH C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin;

Im wanting to just play around on a server for fun no one will play just me and my computer but the server wont load on 127.0.0.1 and it is saying this when I run the source’s run “The system cannot find the path specified.”.

This is what it’s edit is set to.

“C:\Program Files(x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_3\bin\java.exe”

So what am I doing wrong please help as I want to be able to play around and I cant figure out what im doing wrong at all.
